title: UK weather forecast: Four inches of rain to fall in 24 hours amid warning

Around four inches of rain is expected to fall in a day this week as 'danger to life' floods threaten to swamp parts of Britain.

The Met Office has issued two yellow weather warnings, one of which covers most of Wales, while the second stretches from Leeds to Carlisle.

The warnings, which will be in force from noon on Friday to midnight on Saturday, predict up to 100mm of rain in 24 hours in some places.

Forecaster say there is a slight chance of power cuts and loss of services to some homes and businesses in the affected areas.

It also states that where flooding occurs "there is a slight chance of fast flowing or deep floodwater causing danger to life".

Driving conditions are expected to be bad, with trains and bus services also affected.

The Met Office weather warnings state: "Rain is expected to arrive across parts of the UK during Friday and become heavy and persistent, this is especially true for high ground exposed to the strong southwesterly wind.

"There remains some uncertainty to the locations likely to see the highest rainfall totals.

(Image: PA)

"This rain is expected to continue falling in similar areas for around 24 hours. As such during this period 40-60mm of rain is likely, with perhaps as much as 100mm over higher ground."

The average total rainfall in the UK during October is 127mm.

There will be rain in Northern Ireland, western Scotland and south-east England tonight, with mostly dry and cloudy conditions elsewhere.

Through the night it will become mostly cloudy with patchy rain pushing across England and Wales.

(Image: PA)

Rain will ease, with clear spells and showers for Northern Ireland and Scotland.

Showers are expected across England and Wales tomorrow, with the rainfall gradually pushing eastwards, followed by sunny spells and showers in the west.

Things should be bright but wet for Scotland and Northern Ireland.

(Image: PA)

Friday will start dry and sunny but rain will spread in from the south-west across much of the UK later on, with northern Scotland set to see strong winds and showers.

On Saturday, heavy rain looks to affect England and Wales, while Scotland and Northern Ireland will be chilly with showers and some spells of sunshine.

Met Office five-day weather forecast

Today:

Fog in parts of the south lifting, then bright for some but cloudier skies in the southeast moving northwest, bringing showery rain some, especially later. Northern areas windy, with rain in northwest but little to the east of hills.

Tonight:

Rain in parts of central and eastern England easing but turning foggy in places. Rain in western areas, turning lighter as it edges eastwards, followed by clearer, showery weather. Windy.

Thursday:

Fog lifting but areas of rain affecting parts of England and Wales. Clearer weather with heavy, blustery showers in the northwest, following to other western areas. Gales in northwest Scotland.

Outlook for Friday to Sunday:

Unsettled with a band of heavy rain affecting England and Wales on Friday and Saturday with showers elsewhere. Strong winds easing over the weekend but turning colder from the north
description: The Met Office has warned of 'danger to life' flooding in the UK as up to 100mm of rain is expected to fall in certain places
